document.title: academy.codedevils.io
document.description: A LMS platform for students to learn and practice coding skills used by industry professionals.

body.raw:
With the rise of technology, the demand for software developers has increased. However, many students struggle to learn coding skills due to the lack of resources and guidance. To address this issue, while working for CodeDevils' web development team, I embarked on developing a Learning Management System (LMS) platform for CodeDevils' members. This platform provides members with the opportunity to learn and practice coding skills used by industry professionals and build projects to showcase their skills to potential employers.

My role within this project was to design and develop the frontend and backend of the platform using modern web technologies, such as Next.js v14, Tailwind CSS, MySQL, and TypeScript. I also played a role in teaching members who were interested in learning about building full-stack applications for the web.

## Features

- **Courses**: The platform offers a variety of courses on different programming languages and technologies, such as Python, JavaScript, React, and Node.js. Each course includes video lectures, quizzes, and coding exercises to help students learn and practice coding skills.

- **Projects**: Students can work on real-world projects to apply the skills they have learned in the courses. They can collaborate with other students and receive feedback from industry professionals to improve their projects.

- **Coding Challenges**: The platform also offers coding challenges to help students improve their problem-solving skills and prepare for technical interviews. Students can solve coding problems in different programming languages and receive instant feedback on their solutions.

- **Community**: Members can join CodeDevils' Discord server and participate in active discussions, ask questions, and share resources with other students and industry professionals. They can also attend virtual events, such as workshops and coding competitions, to network with like-minded individuals and gain hands-on experience.

- **Career Services**: The platform provides resources and guidance to help students prepare for job interviews and build a strong portfolio to showcase their skills to potential employers. Students can also access job listings and internship opportunities to kickstart their careers in software development.

document.title: Apple Music Discord rich presence
document.description: A Discord rich presence for Apple Music

body.raw:
As an Apple Music user, it was disappointing not being able to display what I'm listening to on Discord. So, I developed a Discord rich presence for Apple Music.

Utilizing the Apple Music API and being part of Apple's developer program, I successfully crafted a Discord rich presence showcasing the current song, artist, and album art from Apple Music.

document.title: clips
document.description: A video sharing platform built using Angular and Firebase.

body.raw:
While I've primarily favored React for web applications, I'm proficient in other technologies as well. To demonstrate my versatility, I embarked on building a video sharing platform using Angular.

Named "Clips," the platform is constructed using Angular and Firebase. Users can upload, watch, like, and comment on videos. Additionally, the application features a robust user authentication system facilitating sign up, log in, and log out functionalities.

body.raw:
![CodeDevils](/projects/codedevils.png)

CodeDevils is an organization at Arizona State University dedicated to fostering a community of software development enthusiasts. Through workshops, hackathons, and various events, they aim to support students in learning and advancing as developers, with the ultimate goal of securing jobs or internships in the tech industry.

My involvement in the website revamp for CodeDevils was multifaceted, serving as both project manager and lead developer. Leading the development effort, I oversaw a complete redesign and reimplementation of the website using the Next.js framework. Additionally, I was responsible for establishing a system enabling members with no prior web development experience to contribute to the project by providing resources and documentation on how to contribute effectively.

Throughout my tenure on the website project, I experienced significant personal growth as a web developer and honed my leadership skills, ensuring team success regardless of its composition.

body.raw:
Like so many others, I wanted a certized place on the internet to showcase my work.

If you like the design, check out the repository on GitHub and maybe star it

document.title: Discord Clone
document.description: A Discord clone built with Next.js 13, React, Socket.io, Prisma, Tailwind, MySQL

body.raw:
![Discord Clone](/projects/discord-clone.png)

For this project, my aim was to construct a Discord clone utilizing Next.js 13, React, Socket.io, Prisma, Tailwind, and MySQL. My primary goal was to grasp the usage of Socket.io in developing a real-time chat application.

This endeavor demonstrates my proficiency in swiftly developing a full-stack application and my adeptness at rapidly acquiring new technologies, as I had no prior experience with Socket.io before undertaking this project.

body.raw:
![CodeDevils Logo](/projects/docs.codedevils.png)

This project was undertaken for the benefit of CodeDevils and its members, driven by a couple of key motives. Firstly, I aimed to address the personal frustration of encountering inadequate documentation when joining the CodeDevils' development team. I wanted future developers of my projects to have clear and accessible guidelines for understanding and contributing to them. Secondly, I sought to provide the CodeDevils' development team with a centralized repository of documentation for all their projects.

During the development of this project, I seized the opportunity to educate CodeDevils' members on the significance of documentation and how to effectively write it, thereby fostering a culture of comprehensive project documentation within the organization.

document.title: gopherphoenix.com
document.description: A local delivery service company in Phoenix, Arizona.

body.raw:
![Gopher Phoenix](/projects/gopherphoenix.com.png)

This website, while not the most visually appealing in retrospect, marked a significant learning milestone as my inaugural freelance project. I was commissioned by a local delivery service company in Phoenix, Arizona, to develop a website for them. Utilizing the Next.js framework, I deployed the website on Vercel, emphasizing a mobile-first approach in its design (albeit with some hindsight acknowledgment of its responsiveness shortcomings).

Despite its imperfections, this project underscores my capacity to rapidly learn and adapt to new technologies and frameworks. Furthermore, it showcases my ability to collaborate with clients and deliver a product tailored to their requirements.

document.title: Notion Clone
document.description: A Notion clone built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS.

body.raw:
In this project, I developed a Notion clone using Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. The application enables users to perform CRUD operations (create, read, update, and delete) on pages, and it includes drag-and-drop functionality for reordering pages.

I undertook this project to enhance my proficiency in building full-stack applications with Next.js and TypeScript. Additionally, I aimed to explore drag-and-drop functionality and implement features like the trash can and soft delete.

## Features

- Create, read, update, and delete pages
- Drag-and-drop functionality for reordering pages
- Dark mode support
- Responsive design

document.title: projecthumanities.asu.edu
document.description: Project Humanities at Arizona State University website

body.raw:
Project Humanities at Arizona State University is an organization dedicated to advancing the humanities and social sciences through research, education, and public engagement. By fostering interdisciplinary collaboration and dialogue, Project Humanities aims to address critical social issues and promote social justice and equity in the community.

During my involvement with the Project Humanities website, I played a pivotal role in enhancing the website's user experience and accessibility. I collaborated with the organization's dirctor and staff to identify key areas for improvement and implemented new features and content to engage visitors and promote the organization's mission.

document.title: wpcarey.asu.edu
document.description: W. P. Carey School of Business at Arizona State University website

body.raw:
This website was constructed using Drupal 8, a content management system facilitating seamless content updates and management. Featuring a responsive design, the website ensures accessibility across diverse devices, spanning from desktop computers to smartphones.

During my tenure at the W. P. Carey School of Business at Arizona State University, I assumed responsibility for overseeing website content, guaranteeing its timeliness and accuracy. Additionally, I collaborated closely with the marketing team to devise and implement new content and features aimed at enhancing the overall user experience.

![W. P. Carey School of Business at Arizona State University website](/projects/wpcarey.png)
